wilayas.name: Adrar
wilayas.description: A vast desert wilaya in the southwest known for its oases and Tuareg heritage.

wilayas.name: Chlef
wilayas.description: Located near the Mediterranean, known for agriculture and scenic mountains.

wilayas.name: Laghouat
wilayas.description: A Saharan gateway with palm groves and historic architecture.

wilayas.name: Oum El Bouaghi
wilayas.description: Famous for Roman ruins and a growing agricultural economy.

wilayas.name: Batna
wilayas.description: Home to the Aurès Mountains and the ancient city of Timgad.

wilayas.name: Béjaïa
wilayas.description: A coastal city known for its port, beaches, and Kabyle culture.

wilayas.name: Biskra
wilayas.description: The 'Gateway to the Sahara', known for its date palms and hot springs.

wilayas.name: Béchar
wilayas.description: A desert wilaya with unique architecture and mining activity.

wilayas.name: Blida
wilayas.description: Close to Algiers, known as the 'City of Roses' with a mild climate.

wilayas.name: Bouira
wilayas.description: Mountainous and green, part of the Kabylie region.

wilayas.name: Tamanrasset
wilayas.description: Deep in the Sahara, a hub for Tuareg culture and desert tourism.

wilayas.name: Tébessa
wilayas.description: Bordering Tunisia, rich with Roman archaeological sites.

wilayas.name: Tlemcen
wilayas.description: A historic Andalusian city with rich Islamic architecture.

wilayas.name: Tiaret
wilayas.description: Highland region with ancient ruins and vast plains.

wilayas.name: Tizi Ouzou
wilayas.description: The heart of Kabylie, known for its strong cultural identity.

wilayas.name: Algiers
wilayas.description: The capital city of Algeria, a political, economic, and cultural center.

wilayas.name: Djelfa
wilayas.description: A steppe region with pastoralism and prehistoric rock art.

wilayas.name: Jijel
wilayas.description: A coastal area with stunning beaches and national parks.

wilayas.name: Sétif
wilayas.description: A major city with Roman ruins and a strong agricultural base.

wilayas.name: Saïda
wilayas.description: Known for its thermal springs and agricultural products.

wilayas.name: Skikda
wilayas.description: A Mediterranean port with Roman sites and beach resorts.

wilayas.name: Sidi Bel Abbès
wilayas.description: A key agricultural and academic center in the west.

wilayas.name: Annaba
wilayas.description: A coastal city with beaches and the ancient site of Hippo Regius.

wilayas.name: Guelma
wilayas.description: Rich in history, with Roman theaters and hot springs.

wilayas.name: Constantine
wilayas.description: Famous for its dramatic bridges and deep cultural heritage.

wilayas.name: Médéa
wilayas.description: A mountainous region with Ottoman architecture and vineyards.

wilayas.name: Mostaganem
wilayas.description: A coastal wilaya known for fishing, beaches, and music.

wilayas.name: M'Sila
wilayas.description: An inland region centered on farming and trade.

wilayas.name: Mascara
wilayas.description: Known for its vineyards and as Emir Abdelkader's birthplace.

wilayas.name: Ouargla
wilayas.description: A desert region rich in oil and historical ksars.

wilayas.name: Oran
wilayas.description: A vibrant port city with a Spanish colonial past.

wilayas.name: El Bayadh
wilayas.description: A Saharan steppe area with nomadic traditions.

wilayas.name: Illizi
wilayas.description: Remote and beautiful, home to Tassili n'Ajjer National Park.

wilayas.name: Bordj Bou Arreridj
wilayas.description: A tech-savvy city with growing industry and education.

wilayas.name: Boumerdès
wilayas.description: A coastal wilaya with science institutes and beautiful shores.

wilayas.name: El Tarf
wilayas.description: Bordering Tunisia, known for its lakes and national parks.

wilayas.name: Tindouf
wilayas.description: Home to Sahrawi refugee camps and important for geopolitics.

wilayas.name: Tissemsilt
wilayas.description: Mountainous and green, with eco-tourism potential.

wilayas.name: El Oued
wilayas.description: Called the 'City of a Thousand Domes', built in the sand dunes.

wilayas.name: Khenchela
wilayas.description: Known for the Aurès mountains and traditional culture.

wilayas.name: Souk Ahras
wilayas.description: Birthplace of St. Augustine, with rich Roman history.

wilayas.name: Tipaza
wilayas.description: A beautiful coastal city with Roman ruins by the sea.

wilayas.name: Mila
wilayas.description: An agricultural wilaya with hills and forests.

wilayas.name: Aïn Defla
wilayas.description: Lush and fertile, known for fruit orchards.

wilayas.name: Naâma
wilayas.description: A desert plateau region with rugged beauty.

wilayas.name: Aïn Témouchent
wilayas.description: A wine-producing coastal wilaya west of Oran.

wilayas.name: Ghardaïa
wilayas.description: A UNESCO-listed town with unique M'zab valley architecture.

wilayas.name: Relizane
wilayas.description: A western wilaya focused on cereals and light industry.

wilayas.name: Timimoun
wilayas.description: An oasis town famous for its red earth and Saharan charm.

wilayas.name: Bordj Badji Mokhtar
wilayas.description: A vast desert wilaya in the deep southwest.

wilayas.name: Ouled Djellal
wilayas.description: Known for agriculture and palm groves in the Sahara.

wilayas.name: Béni Abbès
wilayas.description: A cultural and desert heritage site in southwestern Algeria.

wilayas.name: In Salah
wilayas.description: A desert hub with natural gas fields and extreme heat.

wilayas.name: In Guezzam
wilayas.description: Bordering Niger, known for trans-Saharan trade.

wilayas.name: Touggourt
wilayas.description: Historic oasis town with Saharan architecture.

wilayas.name: Djanet
wilayas.description: Tourism jewel with rock art and sandstone canyons.

wilayas.name: El M'Ghair
wilayas.description: Oasis-based wilaya with desert agriculture.

wilayas.name: El Menia
wilayas.description: Located in the Grand Erg Occidental, known for sand dunes.
